choices.A: If "On demand" is selected, the policy is programmed in the hardware only when the first packet is received through the data path.
choices.D: If "On demand" is selected, the policy is programmed in the hardware only when the APIC detects a VM created in the EPG.
choices.B: If "Immediate" is selected, the policy is programmed in the hardware as soon as the leaf is booted.
choices.C: The "Immediate" and "On demand" options require a port group to be created on the VDS.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. 

Per the "Explanation" from the show answer:

• On Demand - Specifies that the policy is programmed in the hardware policy CAM only when the first packet is received through the data path. This process helps to optimize the hardware space.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct, please check the answer from bellow.

questions.question_text:
APIC EPG Resolution Immediacy is set to "Immediate".
Which statement is true about the Deployment Immediacy for VMM domains associated to EPGs?

discussion.content:
It should be C because only Netconf is based on standards: 
 IETF (Internet Engineering Task Force)
C) NETCONF, the question refers " XML or JSON " not "XML and JSON" , so NETCONF is the correct

Selected Answer: C
While Ansible and REST API are also powerful automation tools, NETCONF is specifically designed for network device configuration, making it a more targeted and suitable choice for this scenario.
I will go for A, Ansible. Netconf: XML data only; Rest API can work (ssh proxy) over SSH, but its kinda overcomplicated. SNMP - no comments. Ansible + Rest/nx-api modules will work.
Why not A - ansible. Ansible allows use over SSH and support both JSON and XML.

Selected Answer: C
C: NETCONF
There is no standardized specification in the REST API

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer.

Netconf supports transport methods as SSH TLS
And also netconf supports json and XML

Selected Answer: C
C is correct!

comments.content:
REST API!! SORRY!

Netconf is only xml!

final answer is B.
The question asks for one XML or JSON so C is correct because NETCONF is an industry standard.

questions.question_text:
An engineer requires a solution to automate the configuration and deployment of remote network devices for a customer. The engineer must keep these considerations in mind:
✑ The customer's environment is based on industry-accepted standards and requires a solution that meets these standards.
✑ The security requirements mandate the use of a secure transport mechanism between the automation software and target devices such as SSH or TLS.
✑ The solution must be implemented using a human-readable language and provide the functionality to format data in XML or JSON.
Which solution must be used to meet these requirements?

Which data structure results from running this Python code?
//IMG//

discussion.content: Dictionary in Python is an unordered collection of data values, used to store data values like a map, which, unlike other Data Types that hold only a single value as an element, Dictionary holds key:value pair. Key-value is provided in the dictionary to make it more optimized.

choices.B: It sends a Cisco device backup to a remote destination
choices.C: It schedules a backup on a Cisco switch using EEM
choices.A: It sends the switch configuration to Cisco TAC
choices.D: It backs up Cisco switches to Cisco Prime Infrastructure

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct!

questions.question_text:

Refer to the exhibit. What is the result of executing this Python code?
questions.answer_description: This will send a copy of the running configuration to an FTP server at 10.83.249.182.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/eem/command/eem-cr-book/eem-cr-e1.html#:~:text=event%20manager%20environment,no%20event%20manager%20environment%20variable%2Dname

Selected Answer: B
B is correct!

N9K-02(config)# event manager environment ?
 WORD Name of the environment variable (Max Size 29)

N9K-02(config)# event manager environment mailerserver ?
 "WORD" Value of the environment variable (Max Size 39)

N9K-02(config)# event manager environment mailerserver "10.10.10.10"
N9K-02(config)#

To set an Embedded Event Manager (EEM) environment variable, use the event manager environment command in global configuration mode. To disable an EEM environment variable, use the no form of this command.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/eem/command/eem-cr-book/eem-cr-e1.html

questions.question_text: An engineer must use the Embedded Event Manager to monitor events that occur on a Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switch. An environment variable needs to be created so that several policies use the monitored events in their actions. The external email server is represented by IP address 10.10.10.10. Which command sets the environment variable?

choices.D: n9k2(config)# event manager policy environment mailserver "10.10.10.10"
